items.title: Free-to-Play
items.description: The game is free to download and play, allowing a wide audience to access its fun and engaging content without any upfront costs.

items.title: Ads in Free Version
items.description: The free version contains ads that may interrupt gameplay, potentially frustrating some users. While ads help support the developers, players looking for an uninterrupted experience may find this drawback significant.

items.title: In-App Purchases
items.description: Some advanced features and items require in-app purchases, which may deter users who prefer entirely free gaming experiences. Players may feel pressured to spend money to unlock certain items.

items.title: Limited Free Content
items.description: While the game starts off strong, some users may find the initial free content runs out relatively quickly, leading to a desire for more levels or scenarios sooner rather than later.

items.title: Occasional Bugs
items.description: Some players have reported occasional bugs or glitches, particularly during complex animations or transitions between levels. While updates aim to improve performance, these issues can disrupt the user experience.

items.title: Repetitive Gameplay
items.description: Players might find certain mechanics repetitive over time as the core concept remains constant across levels. This could lead to a decrease in engagement for those seeking variety in gameplay.

items.title: Free Version
items.description: The free version of Rescue Cut allows users to access a wide array of levels with ads integrated into the gameplay.

items.title: Premium Experience
items.description: Players can opt for a one-time purchase or a subscription model to unlock an ad-free experience and additional content, significantly enhancing gameplay without interruptions.

items.title: In-App Purchases
items.description: Users have the option to make in-app purchases for cosmetic items and hints that enhance gameplay but are not necessary to progress in the game.
